speedrunapi.config.sleepbackground.optio: FPS Limit when the Minecraft window is unfocused after the world has loaded in.
FPS Limit when the Minecraft window is unfocused in the world loading screen.
FPS Limit when the Minecraft window is unfocused while the world is being set up.
The amount of ticks the FPS Limit stays in world setup mode after joining the world.

FPS Limit when the Minecraft window is unfocused and a SleepBackground lock is active.
SleepBackground can be locked by macros by creating a "sleepbg.lock" file in the user directory.
Interval of ticks at which SleepBackground checks if there is an active lock.

Changes how often the world preview gets rendered while a SleepBackground lock is active, relative to every time the loading screen is rendered.
Preview will be rendered every x frames.
Changes how often the game ticks on the loading screen/preview, decreasing this number will reduce reset input latency.

Changes how often the world preview gets rendered, relative to every time the loading screen is rendered.
Preview will be rendered every x frames.
Changes how often the game prints the worldgen progress to the log file, may be useful for macros.
